dataset.alternateIdentifier: Biologic Assessment of Carmel River Lagoon Wetlands
dataset.title: Biologic Assessment of Carmel River Lagoon Wetlands

creator.organizationName: University of California Natural Reserve System

abstract.para: Data on many aspects of the Carmel River Lagoon and adjacent wetlands and riparian vegetation. Vegetation data from 20 quadrats: species lists, ground surface elevation, weighted and index averages of wetland indicator species. Percent cover of 8 transects by jaumea (Jaumea carnosa), baltic rush (Juncus balticus), and silverweed. Discussion of plant succession and changes in local geography since 1774. Vascular plant species list. Baseline vegetation monitoring data for 1995 transects. Marsh profiles of transects showing spatial distribution of species and wetland indicator status. Carmel River Lagoon water surface elevations for 10/1994, 3/1995, and 6/1995. Photodocumentation on 7/18/1995. Map of area showing vegetation and transects.

additionalInfo.para: http://www.pointlobos.org 2 final copies and 1 draft copy in Mary Dellavalleâ€™s office. If Chuck Bancroft is no longer at Point Lobos State Reserve, contact Parks Information Officer Dave Schaechtele at the Monterey District Office, 211 Garden Road, Monterey, CA 93940, or Supervising Ranger Dave Dixon at the same address.

offline.mediumName: Paper 2 copies: green cover and tan cover, with plastic spiral binding

section.para: Prepared for Monterey Penninsula Water Management District to assist in developing a long-term plan to monitor these wetlands
